tool.name: make_ecs_dir

param.name: output_path
param.displayname: ECS project location (folder will be created here)
param.dialogReference: Location where a new ECS run folder should be created. The new folder will have naming pattern: "ECS_Run_Jun2022"

param.name: in_elExclude
param.dialogReference: Input element exclusions table(s). If more than one table is provided, they are joined into a new table using Create Element Exclusion List.

param.name: in_conslands
param.dialogReference: Input conservation lands feature class. A BMI-flattened version of conservation lands will also be created in the ECS inputs geodatabase.

param.name: in_PF
param.dialogReference: Input Procedural Features feature class (optional). This should be the output from the Biotics Tool "Extract Biotics Data". The data will be parsed by site type, with outputs placed in the new ECS inputs geodatabase. You can skip this step, in which case you can copy the PFs to the inputs geodatabase manually.

param.name: in_ConSites
param.dialogReference: Input ConSite feature class (optional). This should be the output from the Biotics Tool "Extract Biotics Data". The data will be parsed by site type, with outputs placed in the new ECS inputs geodatabase. You can skip this step, in which case you should copy the ConSites to the inputs geodatabase manually.

tool.summary: Prepares an existing directory for an Essential ConSite (ECS) run. Creates input and output geodatabases, a folder to hold Excel spreadsheet outputs, and processes element exclusions, conservation lands, and eco-regions data, which are added to the ECS inputs geodatabase.
